definition: War of Liberation (1945-49), after which the Communists 共產黨武裝|共产党武装 under Mao Zedong 毛澤東|毛泽东 took over from the Nationalists 國民政府|国民政府 under Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石
acrobatic display (esp. on horseback) (old)/variant of 懈[xie4] and 邂[xie4] (old)
to transport under guard
to divide/to break up/to split/to separate/to dissolve/to solve/to melt/to remove/to untie/to loosen/to open/to emancipate/to explain/to understand/to know/a solution/a dissection
surname Xie
to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)
to fight/fight/war/battle
to strive for/to vie for/to argue or debate/deficient or lacking (dialect)/how or what (literary)

sentences.english: By late liberation war, the conditions for multi-party cooperation toward maturity.
sentences.chinese: 到了解放战争后期，多党合作的条件趋于成熟。

sentences.english: During the War of Liberation the policy of land reform was carried out in some newly-liberated areas.
sentences.chinese: 在解放战争时期，一些新解放区内实行了土改政策。

sentences.english: Most of them came into the world during the War of Liberation.
sentences.chinese: 他们大多数人是解放战争期间出世的。
解放战争时期，胶东半岛。

sentences.english: This is a heroic company which fought on many fronts in the Liberation War.
sentences.chinese: 这是一支解放战争中经过南征北战的英雄连队。

sentences.english: The Huai-Hai Campaign was essential to the victory of the War of Liberation.
sentences.chinese: 淮海战役对解放战争的胜利至关重要。

sentences.english: It started to fall. In the liberation war, and was cracked down after New China was founded.
sentences.chinese: 解放战争时期哥老会走向没落，新中国成立后被摧毁。

sentences.english: The victory of National Liberation War entirely realized Chinese national independence, and it incarnates the orderliness of historical period of China.
sentences.chinese: 解放战争的胜利是中国历史大周期律的体现。

sentences.english: The Liberation War broke out in autumn , 1946.
sentences.chinese: 一九四六年秋，解放战争已打响。

sentences.english: The tune was composed at the beginning of the War of Liberation.
sentences.chinese: 这支曲子是在解放战争初期谱写的。

sentences.english: The Huai-Hai Campaign was essential to the victory of the War of    Liberation.
sentences.chinese: 淮海战役对解放战争的胜利至关重要。

sentences.english: Both museums descend from the same institution, but were split after the Chinese Civil War.
sentences.chinese: 两院原属一院，于解放战争后分为两馆。

sentences.english: Drifting, how many people died in The liberation war?
sentences.chinese: 沙僧，解放战争死了多少人啊？

definition: (China's) War of Resistance against Japan (1937-1945)
Huaihai Campaign (Nov 1948-Jan 1949), one of the three major campaigns by the People's Liberation Army near the end of the Chinese Civil War, considered the determining battle of the war
Resist US, help North Korea (1950s slogan)
Chinese Civil War, also known as War of Liberation 解放戰爭|解放战争[Jie3 fang4 Zhan4 zheng1]
Liaoshen Campaign (Sep-Nov 1948), the first of the three major campaigns by the People's Liberation Army near the end of the Chinese Civil War
Pingjin Campaign (Nov 1948-Jan 1949), one of the three major campaigns by the People's Liberation Army near the end of the Chinese Civil War
nationalist forces
war of resistance, especially the war against Japan (1937-1945)
Battle of Mt Mengliang in Shandong of 1947 between the Nationalists and Communists
New Fourth army of Republic of China, set up in 1937 and controlled by the communists
Korean War (1950-1953)
Su Yu (1907-1984), PLA commander
Eighth Route Army, the larger of the two major Chinese communist forces fighting the Japanese in the Second Sino-Japanese War (1937-1945)
Nanchang Uprising, 1st August 1927, the beginning of military revolt by the Communists in the Chinese Civil War
communist attack against the Guomindang's encircle and annihilate campaign
Great Victory at Pingxing Pass, ambush of Japanese troops by Communist forces on September 25, 1937 at 平型關|平型关[Ping2 xing2 guan1]
